newsitem.title: UK: Dull UK FTSE ends lower, cable merger dominates.
newsitem.headline: Dull UK FTSE ends lower, cable merger dominates.

text.p: The UK stock market on Tuesday failed to emulate to Monday's record-breaking run as profit-taking, weaker FTSE futures prices and a cautious open on Wall Street put the brakes on investor enthusiasm, dealers said.

The FTSE 100 share index, which on Monday touched a record 4,073.2 points, ended at 4,057.2 on Tuesday, down 15.9 points on the day. Losers outnumbered gainers by more than two to one with 623 million shares traded.
Dealers called volumes healthy but said the market was highly selective, with telecoms and cable stocks accounting for a large proportion, after a giant merger was announced in the cable industry.
